author: Special Correspondent
text:
Chief Minister Jayalalithaa on Saturday inaugurated various buildings constructed for the Public Works Department through video conference.

She inaugurated 700 quarters for government employees at Todhunter Nagar in Saidapet constructed at a total cost of Rs. 100 crore, an official release said. Other buildings for the Department constructed at a cost of Rs. 158 crore were also inaugurated.

Stone laid

Ms. Jayalalithaa also laid the stone for various buildings of the department to be constructed at a total cost of Rs. 626 crore, it added.

A high-level bridge at Melaramanallur, Ariyalur district, nine check-dams and State Water Resources Management Agency office building at Rs. 258 crore were also inaugurated.

A pillar commemorating the historical achievement of notifying the final order of the Cauvery Water Disputes Tribunal in the government of India gazette was also to be constructed in Mettur dam at a cost of Rs. one crore.
title: CM inaugurates buildings
